values:
Happy First Birthday to the love of my life, Connor!  What a wonderful year it's been.  

The super duper birthday extravaganza is Sunday, so lots of pool party pics to follow.

Yay for my baby!  ;)

Oh sweet sweet satellite radio....
How did I live this long without you
I am in love with you
Please marry me....

Yeah, I suck, but I'm really not a bad person. Just a LOT of shit going on the last 2 years. The best part of it all? The Connor man. I now present to you all some Connor cuteness. He's pleased to meet you.

<lj-cut text="Get Yer AlcoHoroscopes Here"> ARIES
Drinking style
Impulsive Aries people like to party and sometimes don't know when to
call it a night. Their competitive streak makes them prone to
closing-time shot contests. They're sloppy, fun drunks, and they get
mighty flirty after a couple tipples. Getting Aries people drunk is a
good way to get what you want out of them, should other methods fail.
Aries can become bellicose when blotto, but they will assume that
whatever happened should be forgiven (if not forgotten) by sunrise. They
can be counted on to do the same for you -- so long as you haven't gone
and done anything really horrible to them last night, you sneaky
Gemini.

TAURUS
Drinking style
Taurus prefers to drink at a leisurely pace, aiming for a mellow glow
rather than a full-on zonk. Since a truly intoxicated Taurus is a
one-person stampede, the kind of bull-in-a-china-shop inebriate who
spills red wine on white carpets and tells fart jokes to employers, the
preference for wining and dining (or Bud and buddies) to body shots and
barfing is quite fortunate for the rest of us. This is not to say
that the Bull is by any means a teetotaler -- god, no. A squiffy Taurus
will get, er, gregarious (full of loudmouth soup, some would say) and is
extremely amusing to drag to a karaoke bar when intoxicated.

GEMINI
Drinking style
Geminis can drink without changing their behavior much -- they're so
naturally chatty and short-attention-spanned that it's just hard to tell
sometimes. They can amaze you by conversing with finesse and allusion,
then doing something to belie an extremely advanced state of
intoxication, like puking in your shoe. Geminis possess the magic
ability to flirt successfully (and uninfuriatingly, which is very
tricky) with several people at once. They like to order different
cocktails every round -- repetition is boring -- and may create a theme
(like yellow drinks: beer, sauvignon blanc and limoncello) for their own
amusement.

CANCER
Drinking style
Cancer is a comfort drinker -- and an extra wine with dinner or an
after-work beer or six can be extra comforting, can't it, Cancer
darling? Like fellow water signs Scorpio and Pisces, Crabs must guard
against lushery. Cancers are brilliant at ferreting out secret parties
and insinuating themselves on VIP lists -- and, in true Hollywood style,
Cancers are never really drunk; instead, they get "tired and emotional"
(read: weepy when lubricated). But there's nothing better than swapping
stories (and spit) over a few bottles of inky red wine with your
favorite Cancer. Even your second-favorite Cancer will do. The sign also
rules the flavor vanilla, and you'd be adored if you served up a vanilla
vodka and soda.

LEO
Drinking style
Leo likes to drink and dance -- they're often fabulous dancers, and
usually pretty good drinkers as well, losing their commanding dignity
and turning kittenish. Of course, they're quite aware they're darling
Leos will be Leos, after all. They generally know their limit, probably
because they loathe losing self-control. When they get over-refreshed,
expect flirting to ensue -- and perhaps not with the one what brung
them. But Leo's not the type to break rules even when drunk, so just try
to ignore it (try harder, Cancer) and expect a sheepish (and hung over)
Lion to make it up to you the next day.

VIRGO
Drinking style
Cerebral Virgos are compelled to impose order onto their bender. Their
famously fussy quest for purity could lead to drinking less than other
signs, sure -- but it could also lead to drinking booze neat, to sucking
down organic wine or just to brand loyalty. They rarely get fully
shellacked -- but, oh, when they do! Virgo's controlled by the
intellect, but there's an unbridled beast lurking within, and they let
it loose when walloped. It's dead sexy (and surprisingly unsloppy). As
one Virgo friend used to declare, "I'm going to drink myself into a low
level of intelligence tonight." A toast to the subgenius IQ!

LIBRA
Drinking style
"I'm jusht a social drinker," slurs Libra, "it's jusht that I'm so damn
social?" Libra loves nothing more than to party, mingle and relate to
everyone. Whether dipped in favor of Good Libra (with Insta-Friend
device set to "on") or heavier on the Evil Libra side (they are little
instigators when bored), the Scales can really work a room. Charming as
they are, Libras are notoriously lacking in self-control, however, which
can get them into all sorts of trouble -- including wearing their wobbly
boots waaaay too early in the evening, flirting with their best friend's
beau or even blacking out the night's events entirely. Oops!

SCORPIO
Drinking style
Don't ever tell Scorpios they've had enough, for they'll smirk at you
and quietly but intentionally keep tippling till they're hog-whimpering
drunk, out of 100-proof spite. Scorpios like to drink, and screw you if
you have a problem with that. Most of them see the sauce as something to
savor in itself, and not as a personality-altering tool -- though if
depressed, self-loathing Scorps seek total obliteration. But generally,
they're fascinating drinking pals, brilliant conversationalists and
dizzying flirts. They also remember everything -- especially what you
did when you were blitzed. Only drink with a Scorpio who likes you.

SAGITTARIUS
Drinking style
In vino veritas -- and, for Sagittarius, in booze blurtiness: When
buttered, they'll spill all your secrets and many of their own.
Tactlessness aside, Sagittarius is just plain fun to drink with. This is
a sign of serious partying (what else would you expect from the sign of
Sinatra, Keith Richards, the Bush twins and Anna Nicole Smith?). They're
the people who chat up everyone in the room, then persuade the entire
crowd to travel somewhere else -- like a nightclub, or a playground, or
Cancun. Good-natured hijinks are sure to ensue (including a high
possibility of loopy groping; spontaneous Sag is a brilliant booty
call).

CAPRICORN
Drinking style
Capricorn is usually described as practical, steadfast, money-hungry
and status-thirsty -- no wonder they get left off the astrological
cocktail-party list. But this is the sign of David Bowie and Annie
Lennox, not to mention Elvis. Capricorn is the true rock star:
independent, powerful and seriously charismatic, not too eager to
please. And if they make money being themselves, who are you to quibble?
But just like most rock stars, they're either totally on or totally off,
and they generally need a little social lubricant to loosen up and enjoy
the after party, especially if they can hook up with a cute groupie.

AQUARIUS
Drinking style
Aquarius and drinking don't go together that well (except for water,
that is). They have an innate tendency toward know-it-allism, and if
they get an idea while sizzled, they're more stubborn than a stain or a
stone. If they're throwing a party or organizing an outing, however,
they're too preoccupied with their duties to get combative -- and they
make perfectly charming drunks in that case. Fortunately, they're
usually capital drink-nursers. They also make the best designated
drivers (if you can get them before they start raising their wrist):
Aquarius is fascinated by drunk people and capable of holding
interesting conversations with soused strangers while sober.

PISCES
Drinking style
If you're a Pisces, you've probably already heard that you share a sign
and an addictive personality -- with Liz Taylor, Liza Minelli and Kurt
Cobain. Not only do Pisces like to lose themselves in the dreamy,
out-there feeling that only hooch can give, but they build up a mighty
tolerance fast. Who needs an expensive date like that? On the other
hand, they're fabulously enchanting partners, whether in conversation or
in crime. With the right Pisces, you can start out sharing a pitcher of
margaritas and wind up in bed together for days. The phrase "addictive
personality" can be read two ways, you know.</lj-cut>

I hope everyone had a fantabulous holiday!

Two insane things I did today:
1. Spent 10 hours at the mall taking advantage of after-Christmas sales

2. After whining for 2 years about how bad I wanted a Lulu Guinness purse, I finally 
   dropped the $225 for one

Yes, I know.  I'm an insane freak.

But now I'm an insane freak with a Lulu Guinness purse.

Fashion slavery bites.

I haven't been around lately (Trixie was in the doggie hospital-long story-she's better now), and I need to update soon, but I wanted to pop in and wish everyone a very Merry Christmas!

Big hugs to everyone!

OH!  Before I forget...I hate to ask this here, but I need to know if <lj user="girlmitzi">,  <lj user="martinsnewteeth">, <lj user="wilderlove">,  <lj user="soulsister101"> and <lj user="strangemodegirl"> have Windows Media Player or have another means of playing a .wmv file.  Unless I find a way to convert a little somethin' special I have for y'all.  ;)

Warning:  Use of medical terminology in following rant.  Sorry, but I really need to vent.

How do I get roped into doing big ass projects at work that initially have nothing to do with me?  The "Big Doctor On Campus" was asked to do a study on COPD patients with FVC<70% who smoked for more than 10 years..blah blah blah.  So he asks Nurse Mary Sunshine to gather the info and she completely panics and freaks out because 1.the computer scares her and 2.she has no idea how to figure out FVC<70% (which is really sad considering she is a nurse for a pulmonary practice.  Even I know how to do this).  I make a simple suggestion about running reports to eliminate patients, and end up having to do most of the reports myself.

Next time I keep my big ass mouth shut and let Nurse Mary Sunshine completely screw herself.

My friends, I have a horrible confession to make.  I'm embarassed and ashamed, but it's time to come clean.

I am hopelessly addicted to Rich Girls on MTV and now to that Paris Hilton trash, The Simple Life.  I can't explain this addiction.  I hate every fucking one of these stupid girls, but quite like a train wreck, can't stop watching their crap shows.  My coworkers and I delight in ripping these girls to shreds every day and it's not jealousy.  Quite the opposite.  All these girls have is their parents money and not much else.  Sad, really, but you won't see me shedding any tears.  Stupid cows.

I feel much better now.  Thank you.

The weekend was 70% sucky on so many different levels and I don't even want to get into any of them, so I'll talk about the nice stuff instead.

For some reason I've dreamt about Dave Gahan Saturday and Sunday nights.  Maybe he's sending me secret vibes so I'll recrush.  Guess what, Dave.  It worked, you bastard.

Saturday's: Was in a large European venue before one of his shows.  He and I sat off to the side of the stage in folding chairs just talking.  Then I was in a limo with the crazy European fans screaming at me wanting to know who I was.

Sunday's:  I was in NY waiting for Dave to come back from tour/rehab, whatever.  I decided to take a shower in public bus outside his apartment building and when he still hadn't shown up, walk down the street.  At the end of his street was a gigantic Sephora!  Being the cosmetics whore I am, I filled up a basket and was at the checkout when you-know-who shows up and puts his good arm around me because the other was in a sling.  He offered to pay for my warpaint and signed the credit slip as "Fiona Gahan" because he said my name was eaiser to write.  We walked down the street with out arms around each other, but I was suddenly amazon woman because I was able to rest my head on top of his.

Does this mean that I'll be wife #4?

A woman from Chicago and another from the East coast were seated side by
side on an airplane.

The woman from Chicago, being friendly and all, said: "So, where are you
from?"

The East coast woman said, "From a place where they know better than to
use a preposition at the end of a sentence."

The woman from Chicago sat quietly for a few moments and then replied:
"So, where are you from, bitch?"

Is there anything sexier than a tanned, oiled down Keanu in leather pants?  Thank you, Kenneth Branagh for overlooking his mediocre acting abilities and casting him as the evil Don John in Much Ado About Nothing. Even if it was only to endulge my dirty fantasies.

My brain hurts, but I do believe I have figured out the entire Matrix trilogy.  At least from my point of view.  I can't listen to any other theories right now as, well, my brain still hurts...

So I guess me and Kelly are friends again cuz we took the kids to see Matrix Revolution tonight.  I felt bad for the kids because they were SO confused at the end, but I liked it better than Reloaded.  I like the fact that I actually have to sit and get my thoughts together about the ending.

I think I will do that now.

Just got back from the screening of Duran's Greatest, which was a fabulous time. Dragged Jorden and Ed with me and met up with Kelly and Jerry.  I warned Jorden that I stuck his name in the raffel, and guess who was the first winner of a DD t-shirt?? Being in a theater full of Duranies with the beer flowing is a heavenly thing.  I could only pray that Depeche would do such a thing for the 101 release.

Kelly & I got into a huge fight rehashing something that happened at a Duran show 3 years ago and resulted in me missing 2 of the 5 shows that tour.  It started tonight when she said to someone "Well, I saw them 5 days in a row 3 years ago" and resulted in me responding "I could have been at all 5 shows if Kelly hadn't..." Blah blah blah.  I guess I have some hurt feelings about what transpired but I'll get over it - especially since she apologized.  I also suppose that I wouldn't have told the story 4 times and pissed her off if I hadn't been on vicodin and still drinking beer with her bad influence husband....

Yeah, I'm home.  Damn my sciatic nerve!  Decided to pinch at 6:45AM Saturday as I was on my way to the Nordstrom cosmetic trend show. I love gimping around a crowded trend show!  

The show was good.  My friend Shelby works for Laura Mercier, so Steph and I got our makeovers done at their counter.  She wanted MAC, but I think there's only so many times in your life you can get a MAC makeover.  Anyhow, loved the MA, loved the makeover and was suckered into buying a bunch of product.  However, noone told me that Laura Mercier products are significantly more expensive than most department store products and I almost fainted at the total for 6 items.  Needless to say, I have a bag of Laura Mercier products waiting to be returned to Nordstrom.

The halloween parties were fun.  Will post pics soon (right after the Vegas pics-ha!).  The 80's party costumes were more creative.  I think my Tammy Faye was a hit and even though I previously bitched about the price of Laura Mercier cosmetics, her all in one cleanser/toner/makeup remover got rid of ALL my Tammy Faye eye makeup in just one cleansing!  Yay!

Now I go lay on my back and watch trashy daytime TV.

The kids just came by to pick up their costumes. They look too damn cute. Here's a preview. Kelly just took them home to put the black gel in their hair and I'm pissed that I forgot to tell Ciara to put her PVC pants on for this pic, but I must say they look pretty damn good. Go me! Ciara as Trinity with her trusty sidekick Trixie: Aidan as Neo: Damn, I love Halloween!

That I love my dog, Trixie Doodle.  She seems so genuinely happy that I'm home hangin' with her today.  She's been laying around with me, putting her head in my lap and even crying outside the bathroom door until I'd let her in.  And it's not even like she wants anything.  She went out, was fed and had her treat.  Unconditional love rocks.  I love my 100 lb. puppy dog.

Guess who's getting a box of Crest Whitestrips and a Mach 3 razor for Christmas? Damn him. Just when I was on the verge of a recrush. Jennifer should be slapped silly for letting him run around looking like that. She's an unfit wife.

Wednesday, November 5, 7:30 p.m.
The Onion presents
the greatest Duran Duran viewing party ever!

The new Duran Duran DVD set, Greatest, contains three hours of videos and more on two DVDs. Come get a sneak peek on the giant screen at the Brew & View, enter to win great prizes (including two tickets to see Duran Duran on November 17 at the House Of Blues), and buy a copy of the new DVD set from Tower Records at a special night-of price!

Brew & View at the Vic Theatre
3145 N. Sheffield
312.618.VIEW
Free Admission

First Rerun, now Roddy?? Who's next???? And is it me or is it quite odd that a man would get breast cancer? I guess I've just never heard of it before. From etonline: 'PRICE IS RIGHT''S RODDY DIES October 27, 2003 ROD RODDY, the TV announcer and sidekick best known for shouting "Come on down!" on "The Price is Right," has passed away. Roddy had been suffering from three types of cancer -- colon, breast and prostate -- and died Monday afternoon in a Los Angeles hospital. The entertainer had been with the popular daytime game show for over 16 years, narrated ABC's "Soap" sitcom, and also had an extensive radio career hosting both music and talk shows. Roddy was also the official ambassador of Chaing Mai, Thailand, where he procured his colorful Thai silk wardrobe for TV. He was 66.

Today is my 2 year anniversary.  Yay me & Geoff!  I spent it w/Jorden looking for a tacky 80's dress to complete my halloween costume and I scored big. Then had an anniversary dinner w/the man.  

Friday was the Bulls tip-off lunch.  My office sent 5 of us and I realized that since Michael Jordan left the Bulls, I have no idea who any of the players are.  Except for Scottie Pippen and that's just because...well...he's Scottie. Even uglier in person.  Whatever - got us out of the office for the day and a free $80 lunch.

Spent 10 hours finishing Ciara & Aidan's halloween costumes Saturday.  They're going to be Trinity & Neo and I must say the costumes came out pretty damn good.  Go me.  Pics to come soon.

Happy birthday tomorrow to Saggy Ass...I mean Simon Le Bon.  Thanks for scamming us once again with $60 tickets to a general admission concert.  This shit better be worth it.  I better be able to have a Simon and John Taylor sandwich for crissakes. 

I'll end this by publicly admitting that I'm addicted to I Love The 80's Strikes Back and I'd like to bear the children of Michael Ian Black and Hal Sparks. That is all.

Au Revoir, dear Rerun. LOS ANGELES, California (CNN) -- Actor Fred Berry, best known as "Rerun" on the 1970s TV show "What's Happening!!", has died, his business manager said Wednesday. He was 52. Full story at CNN: http://www.cnn.com/2003/SHOWBIZ/TV/10/22/rerun.obit/index.html
So...one more fun thing before I leave on vacation. See y'all Tuesday!

Now who do I blame for ruining my cheesy Vegas vacation?? That big o'l queen Roy or the poor tiger who had no business being onstage in the first place? For once I was contemplating seeing the Seigfried and Roy show and now my hopes and dreams are ruined, I tell you! Ruined! I do hope you get better, Roy. And though I'm thrilled that poor Montecore won't be put down, I still think it sucks that he has to go live in some sucky zoo now. I bet he'll miss living with those big o'l queens. I know I would....

Well, looks like I'm stuck watching a bunch more Cubs games.  Baseball bores me and I refuse to jump on the Cubs bandwagon.  That would make me an official Trixie minus the Jetta.

Speaking of Trixies, Geoff is teaching ours to bark "Go Cubs Go".

Pardon me while I go kill him....

So Duran Duran has decided to further complicate their tour by introducing a fan community where for $35, membership gets you a whole myriad of Duran tour package info, entry into contests, and the coveted presale password. What the fuck? The "member" presale does me no good in Chicago as House of Blues is general admission (there goes the promise of seats in the first few rows) and if GA show members are given early access, the Duranies that have waited in line for 36 hours are sure to kick the crap out of us (you know how mean some of those Duranie chicks can be ). The rest of the good stuff offered by membership "have additional costs". Greedy bastards. Though, despite all this, I will be attending both shows. I'm a sucker. I'll hand it to those Duran boys. They know how to stir up some controversy. The DD message boards are muy entertaining now. MEOW! In closing, I find comfort in knowing down deep in my heart that there is a special hell for annoying Cubs fans and those 2 asshats that host the US version of "What Not To Wear".

It's the little things that make me feel all warm and fuzzy.  Like when bands post messages on "unofficial" message boards to tell their fans they're home after a long tour, tell the fans that they had a "blast" on tour, and thank them for their support.  

Mr. Richard Butler, I love you more and more each day.  Your post on the www.burneddowndays.com discussion board almost brought me to tears, cuz that's the sort of stuff fans want to see.  We need to know you appreciate us and that you care.

Unlike SOME people who toured this year (and shall remain nameless-you know who you are)and just spewed shit to whatever journalist would listen instead of appreciating the fact that despite your shit spewing (and mediocre solo effort), people actually showed up to your gigs.

I guess I just like a little appreciation for my faithfulness.  That is all.

You're Most Like The Season Winter ... You're often depicted as the cold, distant season.
But you're incredibly intelligent, mature and
Independant. You have an air of power around
you - and that can sometimes scare people off.
You're complex, and get hurt easily - so you
rarely let people in if you can help it. You
can be somewhat of a loner, but just as easily
you could be the leader of many. You Tend to be
negative, and hard to relate to, but you give
off a relaxed image despite being insecure -
and secretly many people long to be like you,
not knowing how deep the Winter season really
is. Well done... You're the most inspirational of
seasons :)

?? Which Season Are You ??
brought to you by Quizilla

Looks like Ms. <lj user="strangemodegirl">, Ms. <lj user="wickedlilia"> and I shall be seeing Mr. Bowie in January.  Not the best tix, but our asses will be there!  Wheeeeeee!

Now I'm going back to sleep.

Went to H&M today.  Not impressed.  Don't believe the hype.  Wanted to head over to Neiman's for the beauty event, but got sidetracked by the MAC counter & the Benefit counter at Field's.  So -$80 later, I figured it was time to go home.

Geoff worked late tonight so I headed over to the Brew & View w/ Joe and Jorden for a Kevin Smith marathon (8pm Dogma, 10pm Chasing Amy & midnight Clerks).  So, we see the first two (and much hilarity ensues) but, of course, since Clerks is one of my favorites, these big o'l fags decide they "need" to hit the bars in the middle of it.  I've never seen it on the big screen and apparently never will.  Bastards.

Now must sleep so I can kick some ass to get Bowie tix in the AM.

So I stayed up to watch the Cure on Craig Kilbourn last night.  Hee haw, they played 10:15 Saturday Night.  Now THAT was a treat.  Bob's voice still sounds fantastic.  However, dare I say it, methinks he's not aging too well.  Maybe it's the same makeup.  Maybe it's the same hair.  Dunno, but his face is looking aged.  My poor Bob....

And because of the same makeup and hair, plus the weight gain, I still can not look and him without thinking of Elizabeth Taylor.

It's no secret that I despise a certain asshat coworker.  Sometimes she just GIVES me too much ammo.....

Stupid coworker:  "Oh my God, you guys!  I'm soooo hungry for chocolate!  And that's so wierd because I NEVER eat chocolate!  I haven't had it in sooooo long!"  

Me: "Yeah, like that chocolate cake you wolfed down for so-and-so's birthday last week?"

Asshat.

It's wonderful to end the weekend by doing absolutely nothing.  I still have a bit o'sickness, but it's fading fast and didn't dampen the weekend a bit.

Missed the H&M opening on Friday, which was probably a good thing after seeing the crowds lined up around the building on the news.  I think I'll make it down there this Friday (payday!). 

The In Style thing was good. Got there early and hung with the girlies before the madness began.  They got smart this year and gave you a ticket to recieve your gift bag - probably because of Marcie and I getting in the gift bag line numerous times last year.  Not a whole heck of a lot in it - the new Gilette razor, t-shirt, box of tampons (still questioning this one), full size Essie nailpolish, InStyle magazine(natch), Rembrandt toothpaste, and a few others that escape me. The Spiegel bags were crap.  Vinyl.  Last year they were lovely linen (scored 4). Got a box of the L'Oreal hair color/highlight kit, tons of John Frieda frizz ease stuff, bra fitting by Bali (with 2 free bras in the mail), lots of mini-Evian bottles, snack size Philly cheescakes...oh the list goes on and on.  Still not as good as last year, but madame senior editor reminded us that next year is the InStyle 10 year anniversary, so hopefully they'll have much more free crap for that.

Spent Saturday night at my cousin's housewarming party in middle of nowhere, Illinois. The only good thing about moving to the boonies is the space.  Huge yard, huge house, obscenely huge airplane hangar-like garage/storage area. All for half the price of a small bungalow in the city.  'Twas lovely to see the aunts/uncles/cousins.  I must admit that my family does know how to throw a damn good party and have a damn good time.  I love them.

That is all.  Not looking forward to the week that shall be from hell.  A full system upgrade is not my idea of a good time.

Bah.  I'm sick.  Sinus, upper respiratory, fever...same old same old.  I feel like death warmed over, but that shall not stop me from attending the super duper In Style to-do tomorrow.  Makeup, facials, massages and free stuff?  I'd have to be in an iron lung to miss that (and I doubt that would even stop me).

Bad thing about the In Style thingie.  It's literally in the park part of Lincoln Park.  Don't mess with me, Trixie's or I'll infect you with my sickness!  Poof! Be gone!

I seriously need to get the fuck out of Lincoln Park before I commit a murder.  I needed to stop at Dominick's on the way home, and the one by work is small and gross, so I decide to go to the super duper one on Clybourn, which turns out to be a Trixie mecca.  I wanted to murder every last one of them, starting with the mother Trixies yakking on their ghetto phones while their Trixie spawn sat in the carts(placed strategically in the middle of the aisles - God forbid we actually make room for anyone else!) and screamed bloody murder. I'd then move on to the junior Trixies wandering aimlessly through the store yakking on their ghetto phones and finding the need to flail their free arm about, as if there is no one else in the store, especially not someone trying to pass their rude ass.  And don't even get me started on the Chads (male Trixies).  What the fuck is wrong with people?  No excuse me, no thank you, no please anymore.  I'm going to start responding to people with "go fuck yourself".  If someone sneezes, "go fuck yourself".  If someone bumps into me, "go fuck yourself".  You get the picture.  I think I'll feel better.

I'd also know when I'm going to get the chance to work with adults.  Seems lately that I work with a bunch of 12 year olds.  

Okay, rant over.

You are: Dorothy Vallens from "Blue
Velvet"! Okay, so you're a litte crazy (a
LOT crazy, actually) but you're exotic and
glamorous, and you get to save your son in the
end. You have a happy ending in a DAVID LYNCH
movie! Congratulations!

Which David Lynch heroine are YOU?
brought to you by Quizilla Yay. Dorothy Vallens is my hero.
Ms. <lj user="calliopethemuse ">!!  I need your Yahoo email address STAT!  Regarding a Ms. Hoochie Mama.  New info found today.  Let's just say some things never change.....

Well birthday week has come to a close.  Yay.  Hope to have pics up this week.

Geoff is out of town until Thursday, so I spent the weekend with my favorite boys, Jorden and Joe.  It was gay bar weekend!  Saturday was Big Chicks, Holiday Club (the token straight bar) and Charlies.  Sunday was a lot more fun starting at Hydrate (the new twink bar), Roscoe's (with bad 80's videos all night) and Sidetracks (with even better bad 80's videos).  Good time had by all. Jorden wants me to head out to Sidetracks tonight for Retro night, but I've come to the realization that I'm really getting too old to be heading out to the bars more that twice a week.  How sad is that?

Damn, I'm nosy.  In my intense boredom tonight (even though I have a ton of things I "need" to do) I've found out that it's fun to access the Cook County Assessor's office online, type in the addresses of people I know and find out 1. how much their homes are worth 2.how much land they have and 3. whether or not they've lied about having finished attics or basements to avoid raises in their property taxes.  If you live in Cook County, IL, don't cross me or I'll bust your ass!

Now I need to come up with something fun to do Sunday for my birfday (since Monday is a birthday holiday!).  Gay male go-go dancers have already been suggested.  Any other ideas?

So I think I finally understand the fine art of Craps and decided to test out my new skills on our Casino PC game.  I ended up winning $90,000!  Fake, of course, but gives me more confidence to play table games in Vegas!!

Whoo Fucking Whoo!  Get ready with those big ticket comps Mr. Casino Managers!

You know, it's the little things.  I've become so excited reading the descriptions of the new MAC color collection, Femme Noir (Aug. 28 at a MAC store/counter near you!). I do believe I'll be heading out to grab a few.  Yes indeedy, it is the little things....

Tonight my brother organized a group outing to see Freddy vs Jason.  Yeah.  Um, I'd really like to know how I can get those 2 hours of my life back.  Please.

The trailer for the Texas Chainsaw Massacre remake look interesting though.  The original scared the crap out of me.  I might have to go see this one.

I also thought that Pinhead would have been a better opponent for Freddy.  They can both be witty at times and it would have made for an amusing film at best.  Michael Myers, you were missed.

I've decided to revamp my dollhouse and I need your help. It is a 12 room house and I'm starting from the ground up. Repainting the outside, stripping the existing flooring, wallpaper and carpeting and rewiring where needed. To give you an idea, it looks like this: This is where YOU come in. Help me with a theme, please. Anything. I've toyed with victorian, tudor, goth, etc. but nothing sounds "fabulous". It's a beautiful house and I'm willing to put a lot of time and effort into it. Any help will be appreciated. Thanks!

What a fun show last night.  I have to say that the Furs are in my top 3 must see live acts.  They always put on an amazing show and never dissapoint.  Last night was no exception despite the mini-monsoon.  It rained like a bitch, but they didn't stop and we didn't leave.  Furs fans rock.  The loyalty and camaraderie are like none I've ever seen for a band. Also, since this was Goose Island fest, the beer was goooooood!  The site itself was not at the brewery, but at some steel mill in the "industrial" part o'town, but the horrible stench of ass couldn't keep any of us away.
